intro: Siphocampylus nematosepalus, commonly known as the slender-sepal beggar-ticks, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous stems. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The species is noted for its adaptability to arid environments and its role in supporting local pollinators.
